titleInfo.title: Exploits of Major John Buchanan, the founder of Buchanan's Station
Old times in Tennessee: with historical, political and personal scraps and sketches

mods.identifier: Guild, Jo Conn. Old times in Tennessee: with historical, political and personal scraps and sketches. Nashville, TN: Tavel, Eastman & Howell, 1878.

location.physicalLocation: James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University
Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University

mods.abstract: Chapter 13 of the book, Old Times in Tennessee, describes the life of Major John Buchanan. The chapter emphasizes battles with Indians during the early days of Nashville but also notes family lineage and later experiences.

titleInfo.title: Old times in Tennessee: with historical, political and personal scraps and sketches

mods.accessCondition: Out of copyright May be freely reproduced; May be freely reproduced. Please provide proper attribution of digital image;

relatedItem.abstract: This collection documents the family of James McGill Buchanan (1919-2013), MTSU alumnus and 1986 winner of the Nobel Prize for Economics. His family has deep roots in middle Tennessee, including an 18th-century settler of Nashville and 19th-century Governor. Mr. Buchanan earned his B.S. at Middle Tennessee State Teachers College in 1940, followed by his M.A. in Economics at UT-Knoxville and his Ph.D. at the University of Chicago.
